Posts.Content: I too was fairly bruised after 1st core biopsy, very tender and sore for a number of days afterwards.
Posts.Title: Hard stinging lump

Posts.Content: Hedgewitch you'll find everyone over in the Awake thread, thats where the actual party is, pop on over and say hi
Posts.Title: ONLINE PARTY......

Posts.Content: Hi tasha771,  Diagnosis is the first step, what are you worried about at this stage? Update for me is that lenny was removed on monday and i got home yesterday.  Scar line looks as neat and tidy as it can at this stage and I'm not in too much discomfort considering. I go back a week tomorrow to find out  the results of lenny. At this stage glad lenny has gone and hoping he's not going to cause any more trouble down the line. Must go and do 2nd lot of todays exercises whilst i remember.  Hope all is ok currently with you all. JG
Posts.Title: Phyllodes/sarcoma

Posts.Content: How exciting, not been to an online virtual party for at least 7 years, it was great fun. Question is what to wear.......right out of lucky pants, have a good range of weekend onsies, erm i mean party frocks and guess i won't need to worry about flashing my boobs accidently, see there are some advantages to surgery. Hopefully i can stay awake long enough.
Posts.Title: ONLINE PARTY......

Posts.Content: 7 weeks! OMG that length of wait would kill me, already feel like it's at bursting point. You must have been going through the roof during that time. Feel for you. Glad the RT wasn't too bad for you. Hopefully we'll get to the end soon enough for each of us.
Posts.Title: Phyllodes/sarcoma

Posts.Content: Hi Descat and Scruffi I too have just been diagnosed with a phyllodes borderline tumour. I appreciate that you are perhaps further on in this journey of ours than I currently am, but it's always nice to know you are not alone?
Posts.Title: Phyllodes/sarcoma

Posts.Content: Well date has been set, can you believe it, in just over a weeks time! Confirmed that my PT is approx 12cm, no wonder I'm increasingly uncomfortable as the weeks go by. Just relieved that Lenny the lump will soon be no more, been told will be having 2 of my lymph nodes taken out too. I'm sure it will all go well in December, maybe I'm just odd but I didn't find the mammo when I had one earlier this year that bad.
Posts.Title: Phyllodes/sarcoma

Posts.Content: I decided against reconstruction, I was only really offered the expander when I enquired about the other forms, I was told that they would be best kept as a 'back up' option. I suspect that reasoning may be because I don't tend to carry a lot of spare stuff around with me and I'm pretty active/sporty, which was one of my reasons for not going ahead with it anyway, I don't fancy having extra muscle weaknesses from tissue based recons. I'm happy with my decision, I got to see prosthetics hands on too, so that was good. Hopefully it'll be the right decision but who really knows until you've gone through surgery. Question, did you ever get any pain in your PT? I get some, usually mild enough that it only annoys me in the background rather than really gets to me, but I was getting more shooting pains right through it earlier today mainly in the nipple area, which were a little bit more nippy ( i think I tend to have a reasonable pain threshold so find it hard to describe pain intensity sometimes) More often I get itching, because the skin is so stretched, and a burning, like sunburn/heartburn type pain.
Posts.Title: Phyllodes/sarcoma

Posts.Content: Nightmare! PT isn't meant to affect the lymphs as much as other BC's though? RT hasn't been mentioned yet in my case, but I assume they get a clearer picture when they remove my lump and look at it in closer detail. They'll have plenty to look at! How did you find the RT? I hope your outcome after the last batch of treatment is good. I'm quite small, so i'm leaning towards no reconstruction, as the thought of lots of surgeries does not appeal, I'd probably also have to have the 'good' side done too to match them up as a reconstruct would be far perkier, and I'm not going to be missing much from my natural size anyway. The thought of having to repeat it every 10 or so yrs for replacements doesn't wholly appeal either. Think I'm as sorted as I can be currently in my head with it all, just the nervous wait for dates, and the unknown of how it will go in the end. I'm convinced it has grown again even since last week when I was last at hospital. FX for you too.
Posts.Title: Phyllodes/sarcoma

Posts.Content: Hi scruffi Sorry to hear that your facing another pt, no wonder you are feeling down, that's a lot of surgery, i take it they have managed clear margins each time, i kind of know how you are feeling with the sudden short time span in which to make a choice. As descat says, rant away that's what here is for.
Posts.Title: Phyllodes/sarcoma

Posts.Content: Thanks Descat I was dx with a fibroadenoma about 6m ago, but that only measured 9mm, and i suspect that that was not what I felt at the time that prompted me to get checked out. Come end of Aug start Sept, I had a larger mass and a rapidly larger breast than the other one and went back to GP. Had referral appoint at hosp a few weeks ago where I was scanned and then had a CB, including lymph nodes, I could tell by radiologist and the fact consultant did a biopsy there and then in their office that something was a miss. Results then came back as a borderline PT, plan is due to size of PT and breast size I'm looking at a mastectomy. I go back this week to discuss reconstruction options and to look at dates for surgery. Good to hear you're feeling well after treatment. Do you mind me asking if you're going to have a reconstruction or not? I think I've almost decided which way I'll go, but need to check a few more questions at appointment later this week first.
Posts.Title: Phyllodes/sarcoma

Posts.Content: Thanks! :-) It sure does seem uncommon, or at least not much info out there that can be relied on. And thanks for the welcome
Posts.Title: Phyllodes/sarcoma

Posts.Content: Sometimes there is no escape, but glad you'v got out fairly quick. Hope your feeling better now back in comforts of own home.
Posts.Title: mrsox

Posts.Content: I'm with bigguy, we all heal differently, and will prob depend on lots of factors about how you were before hand too. Like bigguy, i was less tired and sore when not doing much, but on the flip side was bored, fed up and that made me feel down and having little interest in anything. The more active i am and doing things I'm mentally better but feel the effects of the surgery far more and am tired, everyone has their own happy balance,  its just finding it You'll  get there in the end, in your own way and in your own time, what suits you.
Posts.Title: Having a bit of a melt down

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I'm starting RT today, nothing like pinch punch start of the month. Just popped home to get changed and have my lunch. Aloe Vera gel is on standby, must remember to pop into bag to take with me. Good luck to everyone beginning RT this month.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Violets day I hope your 1st RT went well yesterday, sounds like you are well prepared with the exercise etc you've been doing. Lgilly and Sailingangel good luck to you both tomorrow starting out on your RT journey. About to go and get session 4 and my NHS tan is starting to show a bit now. I guess one advantage to them using a bolus is that it's easy to see the area they've treated now the tan is beginning to appear, can't argue with neat straight edges. lol FX for no delays today.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: My last zap was today! A minor celebration amongst other life cr*p that has just hit a huge fan, so don't feel that bouyant by it being done and dusted.  Lgilly, yours seems to have gone quickly, i know you were only a little bit behind me, and mine seems to have gone quickly too. The end is in sight!  I've been grumpy too this week, but put that down more to hormones than RT amongst other things. Lol
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Lgilly, same as you, august , well done on getting to your last one, it does seem to go quickly doesn't it. All the best with the next lot of chemo, no fun, but great doub,e celebration in the summer for you. Jacs, as you know, i had major meltdowns too last week, must have been in the air, sometimes theres nowhere else for it to go other than out, before you know it the last few zaps will be left to go. I'm feeling a bit tireder now it's ended, does depend what I've been doing, but not been doing anything mad, in fact i was  abit out of breath going from the sofa to the phone the other day, could be the cold ive still got too though. Skin still in general ok other than looks like got heat rash on th3 red patch in places at the moment, occasionally itchy, but all good really. Feel for anyone having to make daily journeys if the beast from the east descends as much as has been forecast, for that i am grateful. Make sure you travel safely if you do end up with lots of snow.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I'm having 15, i started this week, so have had 2, 13 more to go. I've just got to dodge the afternoon rush hour traffic, was ok on friday but my 1st appoint over ran over so got caught up in it. How many are you having? All the best for your treatment.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: You'll be fine, 1st time for anyone, we all feel the same. Once you go through the double doors, head round to the right of the desk that's straight in front of you, there is the RT desk along the corridor just on left through doorway once you get round that initial corner. Which machine you on? Seems to be going fine so far. Seems to be getting quicker once I'm in.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Caz i too work in school, i know depending on role etc it can be trickier, but you are entitled to time off for appoints. I'm currently finishing at lunchtime to enable me to go home have my lunch, get changed and drive in for a 3pm appoint. I understand the frustration of delays, my machine has been on the blip all week, however today i  got taken in 15mins early. Fx its running smother today. I take a book and enjoy as best i can the chance to switch off from life a bit whilst I'm waiting, my trouble is then getting back in time for my kids if my appoint over runs as i get stuck in rush hr traffic
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Lgilly   they'll give you a big pump of emollient cream and a steroid cream, I'm too at the western, but in the afternoon. Don't envy you the journey in at that time of the day, i know you will, but give yourself plenty of time to get there.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hows everyone getting on? I can't believe I've only got 6 left to go, it's strangely gone quite quickly. Bit gutted its in the way of me being able to do my usual 2 days half term activities but hey ho, could be worse. Skin looking much redder today after session. Tiredness pretty normal for me, so so far so good. Cold bug I've picked up knocked me for 6 last night, but feeling remarkably chipper tonight
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I'm currently working in effect half days during treatment for as long as is possible, depending on how it leaves me feeling as the sessions progress, i too can luckily drive to the hospital, if i couldn't it'd be a long bus ride, which i wouldn't fancy doing daily.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Caz, that's definitely trickier, having been on supply list for a number of years, i fully understand. Good luckvwith your rt, hopefully hold ups will be kept to a minimum, but try and take the waiting time as time where you have to just sit and have some enforced peace, time out time, and deal with life afterwards, your health is the most important thing at the mo, other than the need to work obviously!
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I'm 2 down, 13 to go. Kind of nice being in eased in with 2 sessions and then 2 days off. 1st appoint took ages, but yesterday was only 15 mins. Was a bit tingly the first day, but nothing yesterday other than feeling a little spaced out for an hr or so directly after.  I too am doing the breath hold and it's really been not a problem at all.  No bells where i am, not seen one anywhere anyway, for me I'm not that bothered as i don't like attention being drawn to me, especially in public places, but for those of you that do and can, go ring it well.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I'm on 4, although yesterday and today was on 5.  I didn't get shown where to go when i was in for planning ct! Nice long walk down the corridor for 4&5, they share same waiting area, shame your morning and I'm afternoons.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Lgilly  all the best for your last few, really we could almost be twins, except i escape the chemo part of things...... hopefully we can both celebrate well in the summer   I survived my first full day in work since rt began, was nice to be able to chat over lunch etc instead of rushing off home. Just hope the tiredness keeps at bay as much as possible.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Ooops nightmare, hope you had a good book or were able to go for a coffee somewhere
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Jacmatholmad aw nightmare, fx you don't need to go through planning again!  I've just had zap no 10...double figures already, only 5 more to go. Review today was fine, skin red, no surprises there, but still holding up, being good at cream application hopefully will pay off, even on monday when i went to bed super early as head was exploding due to headache from hell, i somehow managed to still do my bedtime application, even though last thing i wanted to do. I'm not too tired currently, maybe a teeny bit more due to cold, but not anything i would class as rt related, guess it could hit anytime though, still managing to work so all good, but only doing mornings at mo anyway so that is probably helping. Seems the carpark wardens know me now too after a week and a half and a bit of banter with one of them yesterday, got a more personal welcome today, no more showing my appointment letter pass, every little helps with the mundaneness of travelling in each day, or maybe I'm just easily pleased. Lo.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Intersting Lgilly  seeing as we are being treated in same place. I got told just to use a roll on deodorant, which is what i use anyway, never got told it had to be a specfic one. I've been flipping between my usual one and biosen anyway. Just water when showering was mentioned, but was also told could use shower gel like simple, that was fragrance free and mild. Did you get a leaflet when you were given your creams? Only 4 zaps left to go, time has gone quickly. Today has been the first day i didn't really want to drag myself in, but think that's because it's not been my usual daily routine today as no work this morning, and was geting lots of sinus headaches this morning so just wanted to curl up on sofa and not move.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I've not used it for lymph purposes but i use keisio tape a lot for sports related stuff, and it does do the job for what I've used it for in the past, really interested to hear about its uses for lymph drainage, could come in handy. I myself would persevere with it. As sally says you can trim off any peeling parts, and it will normally stay on with showering etc so should last a few days if not a week.
Posts.Title: Kinesio Taping - request for information

Posts.Content: Louise I've only just had a MX without recon last month and no chemo, so not as far down line as you, but I'm also slender, so I can relate to the only feeling ribs and uncomfortable to lie on that side, in fact no where near trying that side at all, I've only just progressed from my back to my non operated side at night for sleeping. I have some firmness in my armpit area, and of course the skin is tight too in places, but \I find that if I don't do enough of my exercises each day it soon tightens up again, I was told to keep doing my exercises for a number of months past the general 6 week post op period. I see you say that you're having physio in the armpit, is that for the tightness or for something else like cording if you also had nodes removed? What has your BCN or Dr said? For me I expect the chest area to always feel firm, due to the fact there is little underlying tissue there than there once was other than muscle, so feeling ribs is a given i reckon. Everyone also heals differently, so don't feel too disheartened if it's taking longer than you'd think, especially if you're having CT, your body has been through a lot, and still will be with the treatment.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy 3 months ago
